title: How to shortlist a topic to write a book - Quora

response.answer_text: Compare and combine potential topics from outlines into a collection that strives for a major question or theme. The way to do this is to write them all to some length, one or more summary paragraphs, and get a sense of what could be expanded upon, possibly after research. What often happens is that it seems like too much for a single book, or else there are others also on it that have or had interesting angles, and it translates to something else. Try to defend it from criticism as another way to see it develop. Here it may have to field some very basic, disarmingly naive, questions, that point to related complications. Mostly it is about what is worth spending all of that time on, if only because that is what excites the audience. That is going to be a fraction of the thinking that goes into the notes.

Well i am not professional writer but i write quite often so here is the advice that whenever any idea come in your mind note down it in your notebook or on your device and when you have time work on it. Famous writers has stated that it was not their first idea which transform into his/her first novel. So list down as many ideas you got and work on all of them one by one, who know the dumbest topic will became great idea for book in future. Good luck for your book.
